channel.title: Halp, need GFX card dunno what to choose
channel.description:
www.newegg.ca
A good graphics card for no more than $200, thanks
"good core clock/steam processor" quote from friend

item.title: Halp, need GFX card dunno what to choose
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

To have a perfect illusion of everything that can flash, blink and move you shouldn't go below 500 fps.

Time to get a new GFX card.

Read full topic

item.title: Halp, need GFX card dunno what to choose
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Mopman:

Our eyes don’t work like that, nobody sees in fps

You don’t see in fps, but you can’t notice a difference between 90 and 130 fps. Yet you can notice a difference between 20 and 60 fps.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Mopman:

You dont see in fps

You dont see in fps but I heard an average human can see a fulid motion at around 18fps therefore anything else would appear joggy. So whats the point of those 100Hz and even 200Hz TVs?

Read full topic

item.source: Halp, need GFX card dunno what to choose

item.title: Halp, need GFX card dunno what to choose
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

xEnt:

in crysis maybe, in a game where the 9800gtx gets 200fps, the 4870 will get 250-350

But since the refresh rate for the average monitor is 60hz (85hz is usually max) anything over 60fps will look the same, so it doesn’t matter.

You also have to look at the driver quality in addition to hardware quality, in my opinion, Nvidia drivers are superior to ATI’s on all systems, but everyone would agree Nvidia drivers are far superior to ATI’s on linux, so if you use linux, go Nvidia.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Wut? This is the first time ATI have had cards worth buying in years…

item.title: Halp, need GFX card dunno what to choose
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:7, topic:263235”]chrisn2323 that’s not better, thats the old batch of GTX260’s which the 4870 kicks its ass, the old GTX260’s with 192SP’s were hardware locked and limited to it’s full potential so the GTX280’s would sell more, the newer GTX260’s with 216sp’s were released at their chips full power giving a 20-30% boost over the older ones.

If this was the 216 core version, it would have been better than what i posted.[/quote]
so it appears your right. I assumed they took the old ones off the shelves already.

Read full topic
